clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT in Gastric and Pancreatic Cancers
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT in Gastric and Pancreatic Cancers

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the suggested study is to assess the added value of 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT over 18F-FDG PET/CT in evaluating the extent of disease in pancreatic and gastric cancer, malignancies that are known to show variable FDG-avidity, at times, no uptake at all.
Although some studies reported a relatively high sensitivity of FDG-PET/CT for pancreatic cancer, FDG uptake in these tumors is usually only slightly higher than the mean SUV of the pancreas itself [10]. Also, false-negative PET results can be observed in hyperglycemic patients or in subcentimeter lesions, whereas false-positive PET results can occur in some inflammatory states.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the avidity of gastric and pancreatic cancers to 68Ga-FAPI-04.

primary_outcome.measure: Patients who preformed 68Ga-FAPI-04 PSMA and PET/CT FDG.
primary_outcome.description: To compare the detectability of FAPI-04 and FDG for malignant lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Patients who preformed 68Ga-FAPI-04 PSMA and PET/MRI.
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the potential impact of 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT and/or PET/MRI on patient management.

arm_group.description: The study population will include 25 patients with one of the following indications: Exocrine Pancreatic cancer. Gastric carcinoma, either with low-FDG uptake or known to be mucin-producing or signet-ring carcinoma. The study population will include only patients treated in Tel-Aviv Sourasky Medical Center, Tel-Aviv, Israel, and referred by their attending physicians, of whom are part of the hospital staff.

intervention.description: Patients will undergo two scans: first a routine FDG PET scan and a FAPI PET scan, within 10 days. Scans will be interpreted by board certified Nuclear medicine physicians and board certified radiologists. Immunohistochemical analysis with specific staining for FAP will be performed in removed malignant tissues, either at surgery or from biopsy, to assess a possible correlation between the intensity of uptake and the level of FAP expression.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
The study population will include 25 patients with one of the following indications:
1. Exocrine Pancreatic cancer.
2. Gastric carcinoma, either with low-FDG uptake or known to be mucin-producing or signet-ring carcinoma.
- The study population will include only patients treated in Tel-Aviv Sourasky Medical Center, Tel-Aviv, Israel, and referred by their attending physicians, of whom are part of the hospital staff.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years.
- Pregnant females.
- Patients who are reluctant to undergo both FDG and FAPI PET scans.
